meanings.definition: A sharp, pointed, woody projection on the stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The rose bush had thorns that pricked my finger.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the thorns on the cactus.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used thorns to play a prank on the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like thorns, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The thorns on the blackberry bush were like tiny daggers waiting to catch you.

meanings.definition: Anything that causes irritation or pain.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with difficult customers can be a thorn in the side for retail workers.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise outside was a thorn in her ear during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The broken zipper on his backpack was a thorn in his daily routine.
meanings.sent4: The thorn of rejection stung her heart deeply.
meanings.sent5: The thorn of regret haunted him every night.
